@description.name: @description
@description.body: A helper for using the browser history in JavaScript Applications without reloading the main page. Adds entries to the browser history and fires a "request" event when one of the entries was requested by the user (e.g. by clicking on the back button). This class is an abstract template class. Concrete implementations have to provide implementations for the {@link #readState} and {@link #writeState} methods. Browser history support is currently available for Internet Explorer 6/7, Firefox, Opera 9 and WebKit. Safari 2 and older are not yet supported. This module is based on the ideas behind the YUI Browser History Manager by Julien Lecomte (Yahoo), which is described at http://yuiblog.com/blog/2007/02/21/browser-history-manager/. The Yahoo implementation can be found at http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/history/. The original code is licensed under a BSD license (http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/license.txt).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the user moved in the history. The data property of the event holds the state, which was passed to {@link #addToHistory}.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Boolean} Whether the browser supports the 'hashchange' event natively.

@description.body: Adds an entry to the browser history.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
state {String} a string representing the state of the
          application. This command will be delivered in the data property of
          the "request" event.
@param.description:
a string representing the state of the
          application. This command will be delivered in the data property of
          the "request" event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
newTitle {String ? null} the page title to set after the history entry
          is done. This title should represent the new state of the application.

the page title to set after the history entry
          is done. This title should represent the new state of the application.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Navigates back in the browser history. Simulates a back button click.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Navigates forward in the browser history. Simulates a forward button click.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Called on changes to the history using the browser buttons.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: state {String} new state of the history

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Browser dependent function to read the current state of the history

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} current state of the browser history
@return.description: current state of the browser history

@description.name: @description

@description.body: Sets the fragment identifier of the window URL

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the fragment identifier of the top window URL. For gecko browsers we have to use a regular expression to avoid encoding problems.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
